casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellee, v. Butler, Appellant.

[Cite as State v. Butler, 98 Ohio St.3d 1218, 2003-Ohio-2017.]

*1219(No. 2002-0545 Submitted March 26, 2003 Decided May 7, 2003.) Robert D. Horowitz, Stark County Prosecuting Attorney, and Ronald Mark Caldwell, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellee. J. Dean Carro, for appellant. Jim Petro, Attorney General, David M. Gormley, State Solicitor, and Kirk A. Lindsey, Associate Solicitor, urging affirmance for amicus curiae Attorney General of Ohio.

{¶ 1} The cause is dismissed, sua sponte, as having been improvidently allowed.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Valen, Lundberg Stratton and O’Connor, JJ., concur. Anthony Valen, J., of the Twelfth Appellate District, sitting for Cook, J.
